alert.note: Alert for Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 4:09PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Seminole, Lake, Orange and northwestern Osceola Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 408 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lake Harris to near Clermont to Sanford, south to Orlando. These storms were nearly stationary. Numerous thunderstorms are ongoing across the Orlando Metro and southern Lake County, with many more expected to develop over the next hour. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Kissimmee, Sanford, Apopka and Altamonte Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
